Speaker: female narrator
Dialogue: Forces hostile to the United States grow strong in the late 20th Century.

Speaker: female narrator
Dialogue: A great moral crisis grips the nation as social revolution and a breakdown of the criminal justice system threaten society.

Speaker: female narrator
Dialogue: To protect and defend its citizens, the United States Police Force is formed.

Speaker: female narrator
Dialogue: The population of Los Angeles grows to 40 million. The city is ravaged by crime and immorality. A Presidential candidate predicts a millennium earthquake will destroy the city in divine retribution.

Speaker: female narrator
Dialogue: An earthquake measuring 9.6 on the Richter scale hits at 12:59 p.m., August 23rd, in

Speaker: female narrator
Dialogue: After the devastation, the constitution is damned, and the newly elected President accepts a lifetime term of office.

Speaker: female narrator
Dialogue: Fearing a massive terrorist invasion from South America, the United States prepares for war. The Great Wall is built along the southern border, cutting off the flow of illegal aliens.

Speaker: female narrator
Dialogue: Street gangs, South American terrorists and the criminally insane capture Los Angeles, the once-great City of Angels.

Speaker: female narrator
Dialogue: Now an island on the border of civilization, L.A. is a no-man's land of chaos, anarchy and darkness.

Speaker: female narrator
Dialogue: The United States Police Force, like an army, is encamped in the San Gabriel Mountains.

Speaker: female narrator
Dialogue: The President's first act as Permanent Commander-in-Chief is Directive 17: protect and defend the United States from this island of the damned, Hell on Earth.

Speaker: police anchor
Dialogue: He's been the Force's Most Wanted Man for 10 years. Convicted of 27 moral crimes. I can tell you, the excitement around here is...  Here he comes!

Speaker: brazen
Dialogue: Commander Malloy. They're bringing him out, sir.

Speaker: malloy
Dialogue: So we finally got him.

Speaker: police anchor
Dialogue: Hold one! The door is opening!

Speaker: police anchor
Dialogue: Hello, Plissken. Welcome to L.A.

Speaker: police anchor
Dialogue: S.D. Bob Plissken. Special Forces, Black Light, Texas Thunder. Two Purple Hearts. Youngest man ever decorated by the President.

Speaker: police anchor
Dialogue: You've been convicted of 27 moral crimes, Plissken. The murder of an Internal Revenue agent. The kidnapping of a bank president. Gun fighting for profit. The list goes on and on...

Speaker: police anchor
Dialogue: You used to respect the law. Served your country like no man before you. Role model to a generation.

Speaker: police anchor
Dialogue: What happened to you, war hero? You were the best we had.

Speaker: police anchor
Dialogue: The whole world's watching. Every good and decent person who works and hard and follows the rules. What would say to them?

Speaker: police anchor
Dialogue: What would you say to all of us who believed in you, who looked up to you, who thought you stood for right over wrong, good over evil? Be my guest. What do you have to say, Plissken?

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: Call me Snake.

Speaker: brazen
Dialogue: ComStat did a psychosearch on him. Used a database of 5 million sociopathic personalities. He hit the bottom of the curve.

Speaker: malloy
Dialogue: Perfect for the mission. Nobody else can pull it off - not an army, not a man.

Speaker: brazen
Dialogue: Zero emotional developments. Total lack of compassion. A highly developed psychopathic instinct to survive.

Speaker: malloy
Dialogue: How you doin' Plissken?  You like the watch?

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: You assholes didn't bring me here to give me this for 20 years of dedicated service. What'ya want?

Speaker: malloy
Dialogue: At 1030 hours Wednesday, a group of government officials began a tour of the Livermore Defense Lab. The President's daughter, Utopia, was among them.

Speaker: malloy
Dialogue: An hour later, she boarded Air Force 3 to Washington.

Speaker: utopia
Dialogue: To the American people - it is time to rise up and demand the surrender of the President and his corrupt theocracy of lies and terror.

Speaker: malloy
Dialogue: At 1140 hours, she hijacked the plane. We scanned the videotape on VR. Check it out.

Speaker: utopia
Dialogue: Today is Day One of a brand new world. The days of the empire are finished.  To the President - my father, you know what this is.

Speaker: utopia
Dialogue: You know what it will do. Unless you abdicate your throne by tomorrow night, I will use it - on you.

Speaker: congressman
Dialogue: Utopia, please. Give us the prototype. If something should happen -

Speaker: utopia
Dialogue: It will be in my hands - and the hands of my lover.

Speaker: utopia
Dialogue: Yes, my lover. My man. The only real man I've ever known. I'm on my way to his arms.

Speaker: malloy
Dialogue: Somehow during the tour, she came into possession of a prototype transmitting device. We don't know how.

Speaker: brazen
Dialogue: Utopia became depressed after her mother's suicide, began to withdraw into her virtual reality simulator. She'd punch up her own little world in cyberspace and stay in it for days at a time.  Somebody else was in there with her.

Speaker: malloy
Dialogue: Cuervo Jones. Shining Path. Peruvian terrorist. Runs the biggest baddest gang in L.A.

Speaker: brazen
Dialogue: Utopia made tapes of her VR experiences, then tried to erase them. She missed this fragment on the end of her last tape. Cuervo Jones must have tapped into the VR master data bank - and then went prowling around for innocent blood, someone vulnerable to corrupt. Utopia was lonely, looking for something to believe in.

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: Sad story. You got a cigarette?

Speaker: malloy
Dialogue: Shut up, Plissken.

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: What's the little black box do?

Speaker: malloy
Dialogue: Top secret. Only on a need to know.

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: And I don't need to know. So fuck you, I'm goin' to Hollywood.

Speaker: malloy
Dialogue: That's right, big shot. Unless you do what we want you're not coming back.

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: So what's the deal, huh? Go into L.A., find the President's daughter, secure the box, and bring 'em both out - and I'm free?

Speaker: malloy
Dialogue: That's the deal.

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: Tell the President to adopt. I think I'll like L.A.

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: Who are you?

Speaker: malloy
Dialogue: It's the President, for Christ's sake!

Speaker: president
Dialogue: I give you my word. Put the prototype into my hands, and you're a free man.

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: I can see you're real concerned about your daughter.

Speaker: president
Dialogue: Utopia is lost to me. My daughter is gone.

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: Well, I'll think it over.

Speaker: president
Dialogue: You're running out of time.

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: I've been doin' that all my life. Might as well do it in L.A. Everybody else there is.

Speaker: malloy
Dialogue: Well, enjoy it, war hero, cause you got 10 hours to live.

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: Wait a minute, what are you talkin' about?

Speaker: malloy
Dialogue: Having second thoughts?

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: Maybe. But you're not putting any shit in me this time.

Speaker: malloy
Dialogue: You don't understand. It's already in you.

Speaker: malloy
Dialogue: The cigarette girl in New Vegas was an undercover cop. She injected you with incentive toxin. Right now it's swimming in your bloodstream. It'll start to take effect in 9 hours.

Speaker: brazen
Dialogue: It's a strain of the Plutoxin 7 virus. Genetically engineered. 100% pure death. Complete nervous system shutdown. You crash and bleed out like a stuck pig. Not a pretty sight.

Speaker: malloy
Dialogue: Of course there's an anti-toxin. Neutralizes the virus immediately upon injection.  We'll give it to you, but you have to do us this little favor.

Speaker: president
Dialogue: Didn't think we were that stupid, did you?

Speaker: malloy
Dialogue: We're holographs.

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: Get this crap out of me.

Speaker: malloy
Dialogue: I guess we have a deal. Nice to be working with you, Plissken.

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: Call me Snake.

Speaker: brazen
Dialogue: Very sweet little weapon. Core burner. Magnesium ammo. 500 extra rounds.  Oral projectile. Mouth dart. Hold it in your mouth for ten seconds, the coating dissolves, it becomes a weapon.

Speaker: brazen
Dialogue: Urolite. It'll stun the enemy for several seconds.

Speaker: malloy
Dialogue: Tracer. Utopia has a kidnap chip implanted in her arm. You can locate her with this.

Speaker: brazen
Dialogue: This clips right onto your 9mm. Ammo enhancers. Like miniaturized grenades. Blows through anything.

Speaker: malloy
Dialogue: L.A. is in a constant state of warfare. Gangs fighting for the right to rule.

Speaker: brazen
Dialogue: Heavy Third World connections. They get weapons, drugs, fuel, choppers - everything is pumped into the island from the south.

Speaker: malloy
Dialogue: Some areas have power - they're on line to San Onofre.

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: I'll need to know more about this thing.

Speaker: malloy
Dialogue: Only a handful of people are aware of its existence. Let's just say it's the ultimate defensive weapon.

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: Defense against what?

Speaker: malloy
Dialogue: There's a war about to be declared, or didn't you know?

Speaker: malloy
Dialogue: Third World wants to live like we do - and they plan on taking what they want. The Cubans and Brazilians are ready to invade Miami. If the Africans and Colombians make a run at the border, we got a full scale attack on the United States.

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: So what does this thing do?

Speaker: malloy
Dialogue: All you need to know is get it back here by 5 a.m.

Speaker: malloy
Dialogue: You're going over by submarine. One-man submersible. Nuclear powered.

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: Where do I put ashore?

Speaker: malloy
Dialogue: Cahuenga Pass. Make your way up through the mountains toward the Hollywood Bowl. You should be able to pick up Utopia's tracer there.  We have to spare this nation her trial - for treason.

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: So you want me to take her out?  Is that an order from the President?

Speaker: malloy
Dialogue: Let's just say it's what's best for the country.

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: By the way - who gives me the anti-toxin?

Speaker: malloy
Dialogue: A medical team will be standing by.

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: Not you?

Speaker: malloy
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: Good.

Speaker: malloy
Dialogue: Thought you might try that. First clip is filled with blanks. Goodbye, Plissken.

Speaker: malloy
Dialogue: I'm here, Plissken.

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: She's in the green.

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: Locked.

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: 75% power.

Speaker: malloy
Dialogue: Plissken, watch your speed. Lots of obstructions down there.

Speaker: brazen
Dialogue: His reactor's starting to overheat.

Speaker: malloy
Dialogue: Plissken, slow down the sub. You're overloading the power plant.

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: I'm here.

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: It's history. I gotta go.

Speaker: pipeline
Dialogue: Too bad about your boat, man.  You like to surf?

Speaker: pipeline
Dialogue: You look kinda familiar.  You hang out around here much?

Speaker: pipeline
Dialogue: Hey, man. I know who you are. You're Snake Plissken. Man, I can't believe you're really here.

Speaker: pipeline
Dialogue: Kind of a bad neighborhood, Snake.

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: Which way to the Hollywood Bowl?

Speaker: pipeline
Dialogue: Down that way.

Speaker: pipeline
Dialogue: Be careful. Some real strange dudes hangin' out there these days.

Speaker: pipeline
Dialogue: Hey Snake - what're you doin' around here, man?  I heard they busted you up real good in Cleveland...

Speaker: spinal
Dialogue: Take cover, fool.

Speaker: spinal
Dialogue: Let's take him.

Speaker: spinal
Dialogue: Hey. I know you. Snake Plissken.

Speaker: spinal
Dialogue: Hey, what's going down, Snake?

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: I'm looking for somebody.

Speaker: spinal
Dialogue: Who ain't?

Speaker: spinal
Dialogue: Say, is it true what they say about Cleveland, man?

Speaker: spinal
Dialogue: Later, Snake. Thanks for the help. You can always shift down and mojo with us anytime.

Speaker: blonde hooker
Dialogue: It's winnin' time, baby. How about you and I do some celebrating?

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: What's going on?

Speaker: blonde hooker
Dialogue: You must be new around here.  You look familiar. Have I done you before?

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: What's happening?

Speaker: blonde hooker
Dialogue: Easy, man, easy. It's Cuervo Jones' gang. Mescalito Justice. He's the big boss man 'round here tonight.  He's gonna take down the police and make 'em kiss his fine ass.

Speaker: cuervo jones
Dialogue: Snake Plissken.

Speaker: cuervo jones
Dialogue: Later, Snake. We finish it later.

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: Where'd they go?

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: Where are they?

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: Location.

Speaker: sentry
Dialogue: Specimen moving west on Sunset.

Speaker: gatekeeper
Dialogue: Halt!  Are you here for the auction?

Speaker: gatekeeper
Dialogue: Welcome to Beverly Hills.

Speaker: taslima
Dialogue: Hi, Snake. It's so great to meet you. My name's Taslima. I'm a fan of yours.

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: Are you crazy?

Speaker: taslima
Dialogue: A little bit. But pretty soon I'm gonna be dead. So are you, Snake.

Speaker: taslima
Dialogue: I can't believe I got caught.  I run with Midnight Jihad. Iranian gang. Only they kicked me out, cause I screw up sometimes. I forget stuff.

Speaker: taslima
Dialogue: I left my boyfriend's place tonight, took a wrong turn...  Oh, Snake, I'm really kind of out of it sometimes.

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: What are they?

Speaker: taslima
Dialogue: They live here, used to be like us. But after too many silicon implants, their muscles turned to jelly. The only way they survive is to have body parts transplanted over and over again.  Snake, nobody who comes into Beverly Hills gets out alive.

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: No screamin' shit.

Speaker: taslima
Dialogue: Oh no, it's the Doctor.

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: Who?

Speaker: taslima
Dialogue: The Surgeon General of Beverly Hills.

Speaker: the doctor
Dialogue: I've never seen more beautiful specimens. There will be no auction tonight. These body parts will go to those who need them the most.

Speaker: the doctor
Dialogue: What a beautiful blue eye. It's a shame you only have one.

Speaker: taslima
Dialogue: Snake, help me.

Speaker: snake
Dialogue: Why?

Speaker: taslima
Dialogue: I don't know.

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: Don't follow me.

Speaker: taslima
Dialogue: You need help.

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: Like hell I do.

Speaker: taslima
Dialogue: Down this way.

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: This is a dead end.  You took us into a dead end!

Speaker: taslima
Dialogue: I just thought you wanted to get away. I didn't know you wanted to go someplace.

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: Go!

Speaker: taslima
Dialogue: Be careful of the bald cats. They live in these buildings.

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: The what?

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: Are you gonna stand there? Give me the gun!

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: How do we get out of here?

Speaker: taslima
Dialogue: Sewers. Come on.

Speaker: taslima
Dialogue: Down there.

Speaker: taslima
Dialogue: Snake - what is it?

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: How the hell am I supposed to know? This is your damn city.

Speaker: pendejo bob
Dialogue: What're you doing in here?

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: Looking to get out.

Speaker: pendejo bob
Dialogue: Good. I want you out. This is my sewer.

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: Which way?

Speaker: pendejo bob
Dialogue: You're Snake Plissken.

Speaker: taslima
Dialogue: Yes. Isn't he cool?

Speaker: pendejo bob
Dialogue: An honor, Snake. Amigo. They call me Pendejo Bob.

Speaker: pendejo bob
Dialogue: Those damn patients are coming back. You'd better climb aboard.

Speaker: pendejo bob
Dialogue: I use the eye and the music to scare em off. They're so whacked out, man, it works great. Chased a whole bunch of em right off the edge there a few months ago.

Speaker: taslima
Dialogue: How far down does it go?

Speaker: pendejo bob
Dialogue: Don't know - never do hear em land. Earthquake opened it up.

Speaker: pendejo bob
Dialogue: I own this whole place. Used to work here in the old days. I was right in this room when the big one hit. What a mess. We were waist high in shit.  Everybody else ran, but not me. I stayed at my post. Now it's all mine. I brought my whole family, my amigos, down here to live with me.

Speaker: taslima
Dialogue: Gun runners.

Speaker: pendejo bob
Dialogue: Hey, it's a living, baby.

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: Why don't you get out of L.A.? Take a boat to China, take an airplane to Brazil?  Earthquakes, death, shit. Why do you stay?

Speaker: taslima
Dialogue: I don't know. Somehow, I just can't leave.

Speaker: pendejo bob
Dialogue: Y'know, L.A.'s not such a bad place, Snake. We got our problems, sure - but this is paradise, man.

Speaker: pendejo bob
Dialogue: Say, you need anything, Snake? Guns? Explosives? I can get you a crate of hellfire grenades, no problem - five hours.

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: Yeah. So how do I get to Venice?

Speaker: pendejo bob
Dialogue: All the sewers are collapsed under Venice. You have to go topside. Right up there.

Speaker: pendejo bob
Dialogue: Comes out near the Santa Monica Freeway. Just follow the signs. Get off at the Lincoln Exit, turn left.

Speaker: pendejo bob
Dialogue: Nice to meet you, Snake. You too, Miss. You're welcome down here anytime. Anytime at all.

Speaker: taslima
Dialogue: The freeway's over there. But, Snake - I don't think it's such a good idea.

Speaker: taslima
Dialogue: The freeways are dangerous.

Speaker: taslima
Dialogue: Goodbye, Snake.

Speaker: taslima
Dialogue: Sun's coming up in a few hours.

Speaker: taslima
Dialogue: UV's gonna be bad today. I have a friend who's got a place near here. We can crash there if you want, Snake.  I'd love to take care of you. Make you feel good.

Speaker: taslima
Dialogue: I changed my mind. I'm going with you, wherever you're going.

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: What the hell is this?

Speaker: taslima
Dialogue: The freeway.

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: I know that. There are people in some of these cars.

Speaker: taslima
Dialogue: It's where they live. I guess after everything happened, they just needed to do what they'd always done before. During the daytime, they just pull down the shades on their windows and sleep.

Speaker: taslima
Dialogue: What are you gonna do in Venice?

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: Find Cuervo Jones.

Speaker: taslima
Dialogue: No! Stay away, Snake. He's mucho muerte.

Speaker: taslima
Dialogue: Run, Snake...They're coming.

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: Who?

Speaker: taslima
Dialogue: I don't know.

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: Delgado?

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: Stop the damn car.

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: I said pull over.

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: Where is it?

Speaker: cuervo jones
Dialogue: We'll see.

Speaker: cuervo jones
Dialogue: Carrot juice?  Your health.

Speaker: cuervo jones
Dialogue: You're coming out of it, Snake. It hurts real bad.  That's good.

Speaker: cuervo jones
Dialogue: Dying isn't good enough for you. You need pain. You'll never make it to where you want to go without a little pain.

Speaker: cuervo jones
Dialogue: Snake Plissken. American outlaw. So typical of American idealism. The old west, Snake.

Speaker: cuervo jones
Dialogue: Man against the sky. The individual. Freedom. No wonder they hate you so much in America, Snake. You remind them of what they used to be.

Speaker: cuervo jones
Dialogue: Here is the real L.A., Snake.

Speaker: cuervo jones
Dialogue: The poor. The old. The lost. People without hope.

Speaker: cuervo jones
Dialogue: Do you know what they want? One word. Liberation.  Now it's their turn.

Speaker: utopia
Dialogue: Cuervo! LaToya Jackson just won Best Actress.

Speaker: utopia
Dialogue: You said I could hold it.

Speaker: utopia
Dialogue: Who's that?

Speaker: cuervo jones
Dialogue: You never heard of Snake Plissken?

Speaker: utopia
Dialogue: He doesn't look like his picture.  I bet he's fake.

Speaker: cuervo jones
Dialogue: Now go get dressed. We have things to do.

Speaker: utopia
Dialogue: Are we going to eat soon? I'm starved.

Speaker: utopia
Dialogue: Ooww!

Speaker: cuervo jones
Dialogue: Go on now. Do as I say.

Speaker: cuervo jones
Dialogue: I'm going to show her what it means to be a woman - for the first time in her pathetic little life.  Given her love, Snake. Everybody needs love.

Speaker: cuervo jones
Dialogue: You want to hook up with us? Join the revolution? We're all getting out of here tomorrow night.  We're gonna rule the world. Come with us, Snake.

Speaker: cuervo jones
Dialogue: No? Too bad. Well, I told you we'd finish it later. So guess what? It's later.

Speaker: delgado
Dialogue: You're mine now, Snake. All mine.

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: Shit.

Speaker: jamaal
Dialogue: Hey - Snake Plissken, you knew my brother Abdul. He was with you in Cleveland.

Speaker: jamaal
Dialogue: Welcome aboard, Snake.

Speaker: cuervo jones
Dialogue: The time is now. We are the strongest. If we go together, the others will come.  We go for everything, Xi-Ping. But we go together. What do you say?

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: Your brother died owing me, so I'm taking it out in trade. I need a favor...

Speaker: jamaal
Dialogue: Sure, Snake. Anything.

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: I need to get across the court now... without drawing attention to myself.

Speaker: jamaal
Dialogue: Like you ain't gonna stick out like a sore thumb. But we'll do what we can, Snake. Use the clock. Screen and roll. Now let's kick some butt!

Speaker: jamaal
Dialogue: You play much pick-up ball, Snake?

Speaker: jamaal
Dialogue: Whatever happens, watch the shot clock, man.

Speaker: utopia
Dialogue: It's that weird guy again.

Speaker: jamaal
Dialogue: Snake! Shot clock!

Speaker: cuervo jones
Dialogue: That man in black. He's very dangerous.

Speaker: cuervo jones
Dialogue: Yes. We gotta dump him.

Speaker: cuervo jones
Dialogue: I'm betting the cops sent him in. Man, I do not need this. I got a war to win.

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: Where are they going?

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: Not yet.

Speaker: cuervo jones
Dialogue: No!

Speaker: utopia
Dialogue: Lemme go...!

Speaker: cuervo jones
Dialogue: Kill him, kill him...!

Speaker: utopia
Dialogue: My... father sent you... didn't he?  He sent you to kill me...

Speaker: utopia
Dialogue: Didn't he?

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: Shit.

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: Get out of here.

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: I said go!

Speaker: utopia
Dialogue: Don't take it back. Don't give it to him. Please. Let me have it.

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: What does this thing do?

Speaker: utopia
Dialogue: No!

Speaker: cuervo jones
Dialogue: Where is he?

Speaker: cuervo jones
Dialogue: Give it to me.

Speaker: cuervo jones
Dialogue: Give it.

Speaker: prototype voice
Dialogue: I am now armed and ready for use. Use extreme caution. The location of the effected blast area can only be determined by the orbital position of the SatStar Ring.

Speaker: cuervo jones
Dialogue: This is turning out to be my lucky day.  Get this asshole outta here.

Speaker: utopia
Dialogue: Cuervo...?

Speaker: cuervo jones
Dialogue: You're my woman, you understand? You don't let anybody take you away from me without a fight.

Speaker: utopia
Dialogue: I tried...

Speaker: cuervo jones
Dialogue: Understand?

Speaker: utopia
Dialogue: Yes...

Speaker: cuervo jones
Dialogue: Let's go.

Speaker: cuervo jones
Dialogue: Look, baby. They're all mine.

Speaker: malloy
Dialogue: A sky full of enemy choppers on radar. Moving over the city to the southeast.

Speaker: com officer
Dialogue: Commander - massive vehicle and troop movement on the ground. All major streets leading to the southeast.

Speaker: president
Dialogue: What're they doing?

Speaker: malloy
Dialogue: Getting ready to invade.

Speaker: president
Dialogue: So where's Plissken?

Speaker: pendejo bob
Dialogue: Hey, Snake. You okay?  Grab this.

Speaker: pendejo bob
Dialogue: Now hang on.

Speaker: pendejo bob
Dialogue: Hey, Snake...where are you?

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: I'm in another opening... Storm drain... There may be another way up to you...

Speaker: pendejo bob
Dialogue: Snake...  Snake!

Speaker: pipeline
Dialogue: Snake. Saw you at the game tonight. Great shot.  You look like shit.

Speaker: pipeline
Dialogue: You feel those pre-shocks, Snake?

Speaker: pipeline
Dialogue: Could be a big one comin' any minute now...

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: Where's... Cuervo Jones...?

Speaker: pipeline
Dialogue: Long gone. You'll never catch up with him now, Snake.

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: Where?

Speaker: pipeline
Dialogue: Anaheim. Headquarters for everything. The whole town's gonna be there. Things changin' fast around here, Snake. It's not the same as the old days, man.

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: Take me there...

Speaker: pipeline
Dialogue: You ain't doin' so good, Snake. You need help.  You should talk to Hershe. She hates Cuervo. They used to be partners, but they split up.

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: Who?

Speaker: pipeline
Dialogue: Hershe. She lives downtown with Mojo Dellasandro in the big boat. Down that way.

Speaker: pipeline
Dialogue: She's connected with the Black Cowboys, and they don't take shit from nobody...

Speaker: pipeline
Dialogue: Yo', man. It's a big one.

Speaker: pipeline
Dialogue: Tsunami, Snake.

Speaker: pipeline
Dialogue: Surf's up big time.

Speaker: pipeline
Dialogue: Get ready, Snake. It's gonna be some kinda ride.

Speaker: pipeline
Dialogue: Let the front edge pick you up. Don't get on your board till it peaks.

Speaker: pipeline
Dialogue: Don't lose it, man. You slip off your board and it's the Big Wipeout, you know what I mean?

Speaker: pipeline
Dialogue: Hang on, Snake!  YAAAAAAA!!!!

Speaker: pipeline
Dialogue: Awesome, Snake. AWESOME, man!

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: See you later.

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: Listen up. I need directions. Downtown. Somebody named Hershe.

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: Later.

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: Cease fire with the bullshit.

Speaker: cuervo jones
Dialogue: Abandon your firebases by 0500 hours. Have the news media standing by for my coronation. I'm arriving in style.

Speaker: brazen
Dialogue: He must be bouncing the signal from one of our communications satellites.

Speaker: president
Dialogue: That means CableNet has already picked it up. This thing's going live all over the country.

Speaker: cuervo jones
Dialogue: It's a brand new day comin' up this morning, and I'm just so proud to be leading the parade. See you soon, putos.

Speaker: malloy
Dialogue: The prototype appears to be armed, Mr. President.  Shall I begin evacuation?

Speaker: president
Dialogue: Does he know how to activate it?

Speaker: malloy
Dialogue: Well, yeah. All you have to do is push the button.

Speaker: brazen
Dialogue: What about Plissken? He could still be -

Speaker: president
Dialogue: Forget him. He's dead.

Speaker: malloy
Dialogue: That may not be true, Mr. President.  He's one tough case. Plissken's been dead so many times I can't count. But he never stays down.

Speaker: malloy
Dialogue: There are two choices, Mr. President. Wait for Plissken, or surrender. It's your decision.

Speaker: spinal
Dialogue: Hershe - it's Snake Plissken.

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: I need a favor.

Speaker: hershe
Dialogue: What's in it for me?

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: Wait a minute. I know that voice.  You're Carjack Malone.

Speaker: hershe
Dialogue: Not anymore.

Speaker: spinal
Dialogue: You two know each other?

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: You owe me. You left me holdin' everything back there in Cleveland.

Speaker: spinal
Dialogue: Hershe, you were in Cleveland?

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: Yeah. With me and Texas Mike O'Shay.

Speaker: hershe
Dialogue: I was called away on urgent business, Snake.

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: Don't lie to me.

Speaker: hershe
Dialogue: All right, so I made another deal.

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: I got a new deal for you.

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: You help me, you live.

Speaker: spinal
Dialogue: I wouldn't be doin' that, Snake.

Speaker: hershe
Dialogue: We have a little arrangement. Anything happens to me, you're dead.

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: I'm already dead.

Speaker: hershe
Dialogue: I see your point. What's the favor?

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: Get me to Cuervo Jones. Get me to the Kingdom. I got one hour.

Speaker: hershe
Dialogue: Dream on, blue eye.

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: Say goodnight, Carjack.

Speaker: hershe
Dialogue: Wait a minute. All right. Hold on.

Speaker: spinal
Dialogue: Cuervo Jones has more firepower than two armies. No one gets near him.

Speaker: hershe
Dialogue: Exactly what is this prototype? What does it do?

Speaker: hershe
Dialogue: So whoever has it runs the show.

Speaker: spinal
Dialogue: Only Cuervo's got it now.

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: How do you know all this?

Speaker: hershe
Dialogue: So what's the deal, gorgeous?

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: We get the girl and the prototype. And we get out.

Speaker: spinal
Dialogue: All of us?

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: Yeah.

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: We'll see.

Speaker: hershe
Dialogue: Why should we leave? I love L.A. Where we gonna go? What's the payoff?

Speaker: spinal
Dialogue: I'd like to get out but I don't have enough money.

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: The President's promised to give whoever helps me 1 million dollars.

Speaker: spinal
Dialogue: Yeah? Greenbacks? I got ten million of them.

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: Uh-uh. Bluebacks.

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: Bluebacks. I'm not bullshittin'. I swear to God.

Speaker: hershe
Dialogue: I don't know, sounds thin to me.

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: You want to stay here, while Cuervo Jones rules the world?

Speaker: hershe
Dialogue: How are we getting out?

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: I don't know yet.

Speaker: spinal
Dialogue: Shit.

Speaker: hershe
Dialogue: You always were a loser, Plissken. Makin' things up as you go along. That's why I cut out on you in Cleveland. You're just a bum like the rest of us.

Speaker: mojo dellasandro
Dialogue: Use the air.

Speaker: mojo dellasandro
Dialogue: They're burning. Santa Anas. The night wind.

Speaker: spinal
Dialogue: What're you talking about, Mojo?

Speaker: mojo dellasandro
Dialogue: Death from above...

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: Don't like it, don't come.

Speaker: spinal
Dialogue: Where'd you get these rigs, Carjack?

Speaker: hershe
Dialogue: My name is Hershe Hernandez, do you understand, cowboy?

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: Yeah, kinda.

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: If he lets you get close enough.

Speaker: hershe
Dialogue: The wind's up. Let's go.

Speaker: hershe
Dialogue: See you in hell, Snake.

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: If I'm late, Carjack, don't start without me.

Speaker: cuervo jones
Dialogue: They're simple people. They love a party.  We're gonna throw them one hell of a party when we get to America. Right?

Speaker: cuervo jones
Dialogue: Put a smile on your face.

Speaker: bivouac
Dialogue: Cuervo Jones. Welcome, my Brother.

Speaker: cuervo jones
Dialogue: Are you ready for the New World?

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: Is that what I think it is?

Speaker: hershe
Dialogue: Snake. We need some kind of diversion.

Speaker: cuervo jones
Dialogue: Would you please kill him for me?

Speaker: bivouac
Dialogue: My pleasure.

Speaker: cuervo jones
Dialogue: You told me he was dead.

Speaker: cuervo jones
Dialogue: Where?

Speaker: cuervo jones
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: cuervo jones
Dialogue: Where's Plissken?

Speaker: cuervo jones
Dialogue: You're stalling, Eddie.  Talk, you little gringo!

Speaker: cuervo jones
Dialogue: You've lied to me for the very last time.

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: She's overloaded! We're too heavy.

Speaker: hershe
Dialogue: Somebody get off!

Speaker: spinal
Dialogue: Who?

Speaker: hershe
Dialogue: We're not gonna make it over the fuckin' mountain!

Speaker: com officer
Dialogue: Aircraft leaving the island, sir. It's passed into restricted space, heading this way.

Speaker: president
Dialogue: Is it Plissken?

Speaker: com officer
Dialogue: Commander, I'm getting radio contact with the aircraft.

Speaker: malloy
Dialogue: Boost it.

Speaker: president
Dialogue: Thank God.

Speaker: malloy
Dialogue: Plissken - this is Malloy. Do you have the prototype?

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: Yeah, I got it.

Speaker: plisske
Dialogue: Now give me the real one.

Speaker: utopia
Dialogue: Now we're even, Snake.

Speaker: com officer
Dialogue: Commander Malloy - he's got lots of company.

Speaker: malloy
Dialogue: Battle stations...

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: I think we've burned off enough fuel. We may be lighter enough to hover. Just barely.

Speaker: hershe
Dialogue: Can you land?

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: No. The right skid's broken. If I try to set it down she'll crash. I have to stay in a hoverwhile you jump off.  Hey, Carjack. We gotta hide the girl. Give her your dress.

Speaker: hershe
Dialogue: My name is no longer Carjack. Will you please get that through your fucking head?

Speaker: spinal
Dialogue: Holy shit.

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: Don't shoot! They can drag us down into the sea.

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: Take the controls!

Speaker: utopia
Dialogue: What do I do?

Speaker: utopia
Dialogue: Snake, look.

Speaker: president
Dialogue: Where the hell is he going?

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: It's taking all the power we've got to hover.

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: Jump out. Head for the treeline and disappear.

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: Go!

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: All right, baby. Don't be too rough on me. We're gonna land.

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: Where's the anti-toxin...?

Speaker: president
Dialogue: Give me the prototype.

Speaker: malloy
Dialogue: Hold it, Plissken. Now give us the real one.

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: Give me the goddamn shot!

Speaker: malloy
Dialogue: It was all a fake, Plissken.

Speaker: brazen
Dialogue: You were injected with glucose. There is no Plutoxin 7 virus. You were never going to die - at least not from anything we gave you.

Speaker: malloy
Dialogue: C'mon, Snake - it's L.A. Everything's phony, you know that.

Speaker: malloy
Dialogue: Relax, war hero. We took you for a ride, and you came through. Not bad for a dirtbag like you.

Speaker: president
Dialogue: You're free, Plissken. But if you even so much as break wind on a country road I'll crush you like a bug.

Speaker: malloy
Dialogue: You didn't finish the mission, Plissken. We'll have to do that for you.

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: Got a smoke?

Speaker: malloy
Dialogue: You're gonna have to learn to respect the law, Snake. The United States is a no- smoking nation. No smoking, no drinking, do drugs, no women unless you're married, no guns, no foul language. It's a brand new day for you, Snake.

Speaker: plissken
Dialogue: The name's Plissken.

Speaker: duty sergeant
Dialogue: We're being attacked, Commander. The north wall.
